result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Capital raised and founder dilution** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(303) #| eval: true #| results: asis #| echo: false #| warning: false # Valores aleatórios fixos (gerados via Python) seriesapre <- 3.368 seriesapost <- 6.287 seriesbpre <- 38.243 seriesbpost <- 77.473 seriescpre <- 132.115 seriescpost <- 184.012 raise_a <- 2.919 raise_b <- 39.23 raise_c <- 51.897 pct_a <- 53.571 pct_b <- 26.444 pct_c <- 18.986 ``` ::: A company raised capital in three rounds (values in millions USD): Series A: Pre = 3.368, Post = 6.287 Series B: Pre = 38.243, Post = 77.473 Series C: Pre = 132.115, Post = 184.012 ::: {.question-block}
1. How much did the company raise in Series A?
✅ Raised = Post - Pre = 6.287 - 3.368 = **2.919 million**
::: ::: {.question-block}
2. How much did the company raise in Series B?
✅ Raised = Post - Pre = 77.473 - 38.243 = **39.23 million**
::: ::: {.question-block}
3. How much did the company raise in Series C?
✅ Raised = Post - Pre = 184.012 - 132.115 = **51.897 million**
::: ::: {.question-block}
4. What % of shares did founders keep after Series A?
✅ % kept = Pre / Post = 3.368 / 6.287 = **53.571%**
::: ::: {.question-block}
5. What % of shares did founders keep after Series B?
✅ % kept = A × B = (53.571%) × (49.363%) = **26.444%**
::: ::: {.question-block}
6. What % of shares did founders keep after Series C?
✅ % kept = A × B × C = (53.571%) × ... = **18.986%**
::: :::
